Me ha gustado volver a jugarlo, aunque como siempre lo recordaba mejor. El paso de los a√±os no perdonan. Los gr√°ficos no son malos contando los a√±os que tiene, pero el sistema de combate es lo que menos me ha gustado. Me gusta que la historia la cuenten sin cinem√°ticas, que la vayas descubriendo por el escenario. Los puzzles algunos de ellos son un reto, y los caminos de las soluciones pueden ser ambiguos. El jefe final tambi√©n es bastante complicado. Como m√°s disfrutar√°s del juego es en su dificultad m√°s alta. Puedes guardar en cualquier punto, casi simulando los checkpoint de los juegos actuales. Un juego totalmente recomendable a pesar de sus a√±os.

Ok, so... you play gordon freeman a sexy silent strong scientist badass who's skills with various weapons is only matched by his strong character dialouge (none) and impressively strong lucky streak. Gordon Freeman was just your average every day Arnold schwartzenagger in a lab coat testing a rare sample of stuff from this planet demension thing that doesn't technically exist, only for everything to (Shocker) GO HORRIBLY WRONG. The underground highly top secret governmental lab explodes tearing an interdemensional hole into our reality and unleashing an alien invasion upon the world. In response the Government has demanded that everything in the lab DIES. Surprisingly, all these men in the military are just 2 DAYS FROM RETIREMENT! Gordon capitalizes on this and slaughters them all before they kill him, in doing so he makes his way through the crumbling facility, taking everything in his way a brand new copy of ass kicked montly. Everything is falling apart, Gordon decides to travel to this demension, and stop the invasion, only to find out that the leader is a giant baby thing with 3 eyes and telekenitc powers, Gordon blows this bitch up and closes the demensional hole, but now the alien species of Vortagaunts has remained on earth. and now, they need to intergrate into society. Gordon, enjoying his heroic moment, is saved by the mysterious Gman who was watching his entire adventure and put into stasis.... UNTIL PART 2
Would get killed by a headcrab again. 10/10

Undeniably iconic, it set an unprecedented bar of quality for years following its release. Much has been said about [b]Half-Life[/b], so much so that saying anything is likely reiterating upon the words of others. Maybe that isn't such a bad thing, Half-Life still holds up as one of the best FPS ever made, I can hardly fault it on its gameplay; whilst yes some parts are notably weaker than others (Ch 8 and 18 come to mind,) it's still a must play.

Half-life is a very nice gem from the 90's with fun gameplay a very unique and for it's time original form of story telling and there's definetly alot to admire from the alien design to the level design and the ai but how well does it hold up as a game?

Pros
This game has a pretty awesome arsenal of weapons the Taul cannon is probably my favorite
The alien creatures are very well designed and memorable for the most part
The human ai can be pretty good at times focusing on target, flanking, acting wounded and using exsplosives  appropriately
For it's time the level design was pretty good at depicting an advanced government research facility 
It's pretty awesome how every living thing in this game can be gibed into a puddle of gore
Autosaves can be a lifesaver sometimes in this game when you've screwed up with your quicksaves

Cons
This game can be a bit buggy one bug even prevented me from making progress unless I restrarted the level
[spoiler]The Xen levels...[/spoiler]
Trying to climb a ladder in this game can be a nightmare
The boss battles were pretty lame and one of the bosses design/attacks was a bit to suggestive
Platforming isn't very fun in this game
Not a fan of the HD weapons pack it looks odd and theres no option for the classic weapons 

I'd personaly recomend this game any day but considering how generous valve can be with there sales I'd recomend picking it up during a sale as part of the complete Half-life pack or you could get these games one at a time but a fair warning with all the exspanion packs that's gonna take awhile
Lol never thought that so old game would be still enjoyable like games of Nintendo

Having played Half-Life 2 first, I was a little...shocked... to find that the Vortigaunts are some of the bad guys in this game. But other than that, I felt right at home jumping into this game, even though this game is somewhat primitve (in graphics, sound, etc.) compared to HL2. Nevertheless, the eerie atmosphere, the tricky enemies, the interesting sci-fi story - they're all here.

Half-Life can be challenging, but it's a lot of fun. If you're not used to playing 15+ year old shooters, this might not be your game, but if you're like me and you want to see where this excellent series began, or you're a fan of science fiction games, or you're just looking for a good time busting head crabs, then I absolutely recommend Half-Life to you.

Best Game Ever. Get it. If all these new shooters feel generally the same to you with just little tweaks why not start from the beginning? Nice game. Never really got the hype about it since it was released... And after all those years, it just feels akward to play with


EDIT AFTER COMMENT:
It is a nice game, BUT the gameplay, as well as the plot are more than surpassed. Best is probably to say that it WAS a nice game... there are other OLD games much worthier to the test of time, as Monkey Island, or Shogo, or Amerzone. Half Life was much more of a twist to the developer history and tool rather than being really iconic as a game, imho
this is the best game ever i love it.
Vale la pena. El comienzo de una buena historia.

Games such as Quake and Unreal Tournament may have been stepping stones in the evolution of first person shooter games, but Half Life was a breakthrough for the genre when it was released in 1999. Putting the player in total control of the entire experience from beginning to end without any interruptions makes this game a fine example of what you can only accomplish telling your story through a video game.

On top of its presentational merits, the aspiring visionaries at Valve didn't slouch anywhere else either, pushing many machines to its limits with high resolution graphics in an era where digital distribution was only a pipe dream with dial-up connections.   It may seem dated by today's standards, but back then, this was unquestionably top of the line !

I can't recommend Half Life enough for everything it managed to do, setting new standards across the board for everything thereafter !

game runs good on bad laptop and its fun to paly and can be played again and again.

It's like an old fleshlight.

It's old, smells funny, and the youth don't respect it as much as we do, but it gets the damn job done.

This is one of those games that I would often think about during the course of my day. I'd be thirsting to engage in this immersive lil' world, hoping my friends wouldn't make plans for the night. Sometimes they did, and that's okay, because I could play the next evening! Of course, there were a couple times that I would skip out on socializing/sex to assume the role of Dr. Freeman, without regrets.

I love the dated graphics because they helped me empathize with gamers' expectations in 1998. Though I was sometimes aware of the mechanics being superseded by current games, that didn't change the fact that this game employs really thoughtful design. The path to progress is riddled with lovely puzzles and tense combat, (almost) always stimulating. I absolutely loved the AI using grenades to foil cheap tactics; I felt like a better player after completing a battle.

There wasn't much I disliked about this game. I didn't care for the relatively low inertia of movement, especially when amplified by puddles! The 'On Rails' bit felt somewhat labourious, but I appreciate the variety of elements in this quest. I actually loved the Xen section, with its imaginitive environmental design and overall uncanny atmosphere.

In conclusion: I have nothing new to say about this game.

The best single player intro of all times !!

So I really wanted to play this again... but for the last time. This game has aged pretty well, and I remember playing it waaay back in the day on my sweet 200 Mhz Pentium 1... It struggled mightily. But the game is still as I remember it. Fun, challenging, humorous. It was great reliving the battle one more time. One last time.
